OriginalSource.Creator: Terese Winslow
OriginalSource.Comment: Changed title to DNA Structure; made it clear that only one strand of DNA is coming out of the tip of the chromosome; corrected hydrogen bonds between the base pairs; removed the line pointing from the DNA label to the chromosome; extended the bracket showing a Gene so that the upper end of it is about halfway between where it is now and the first nucleosome; removed the parenthetical (during cell division) from the Chromosome label; moved the tip of the shaded triangle that points from the chromosome to the nucleus over; added a small bracket around one of the nucleosomes and added the label “Nucleosome”; pointed the label “Histone” to one of the subunits of the Nucleosome

Labeled one of the histone proteins “Histone”; removed the label for “Supercoiled DNA”; made the bracket for the Gene almost as long as the DNA double helix area, and removed the label for "DNA double helix"; added label for "DNA".

ContentDescriptions.ContentDescription: Structure of DNA; drawing shows a chromosome, nucleosome, histone, gene, and nucleotide base pairs: guanine, cytosine, adenine, and thymine. Also shown is a cell and its nucleus.
Structure of DNA; drawing shows a chromosome, nucleosome, histone, gene, and nucleotide base pairs: guanine, cytosine, adenine, and thymine. Also shown is a cell and its nucleus.

Captions.MediaCaption: Structure of DNA. Most DNA is found inside the nucleus of a cell, where it forms the chromosomes. Chromosomes have proteins called histones that bind to DNA. DNA has two strands that twist into the shape of a spiral ladder called a helix. DNA is made up of four building blocks called nucleotides: adenine (A), thymine (T), guanine (G), and cytosine (C). The nucleotides attach to each other (A with T, and G with C) to form chemical bonds called base pairs, which connect the two DNA strands. Genes are short pieces of DNA that carry specific genetic information.

Structure of DNA. Most DNA is found inside the nucleus of a cell, where it forms the chromosomes. Chromosomes have proteins called histones that bind to DNA. DNA has two strands that twist into the shape of a spiral ladder called a helix. DNA is made up of four building blocks called nucleotides: adenine (A), thymine (T), guanine (G), and cytosine (C). The nucleotides attach to each other (A with T, and G with C) to form chemical bonds called base pairs, which connect the two DNA strands. Genes are short pieces of DNA that carry specific genetic information.
